intro: Hieracium pyrgosense, commonly known as the Pyrgos hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are generally basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium pyrgosense is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to the mild, dry climate of its native range.
